questions.question: A factory produces 2,500 toys every hour. How many toys does it produce in 4 weeks if it operates 24 hours a day, 7 days a week?
A book series has 8 books. Book 1 sold 125,000 copies. Each subsequent book sold 15,000 more copies than the previous one. How many copies did Book 8 sell?
A city's population grows by 25,000 people each year. If the current population is 4,750,000, what will it be in 6 years?
A stadium has seats arranged in sections: Section A: 12,500 seats, Section B: 15,750 seats, Section C: 18,250 seats. How many more seats does Section C have than Section A?
A printing company prints 8,000 newspapers every 2 hours. How many newspapers do they print in 5 days, working 12 hours each day?
questions.explanation: Newspapers per hour: 8,000 ÷ 2 = 4,000. Hours in 5 days: 5 × 12 = 60. Total: 4,000 × 60 = 240,000

questions.question: The number of website visitors follows this pattern: Day 1: 125,000, Day 2: 150,000, Day 3: 175,000. If the pattern continues, how many visitors on Day 7?
A school district has 3,750,000 textbooks. If each school gets 15,000 textbooks and there are 250 schools, are there enough textbooks?
questions.explanation: Textbooks needed: 250 × 15,000 = 3,750,000. Available: 3,750,000. So exactly enough

questions.question: A car manufacturer produces 1,250 cars per day. After upgrading machinery, production increases by 20%. How many cars are produced daily now?
questions.explanation: 20% of 1,250 = 250. New production: 1,250 + 250 = 1,500 cars per day

questions.question: A book has 2,450,750 words. The sequel has 850,250 more words. How many words do both books have altogether?
A marathon had 42,500 participants this year. Next year, organizers want to increase participation by 12%. How many participants do they hope to have next year?
